docs.snippet: THE MAYOR AND HIS FRIENDS. Our readers will remember that, in 1859, under the authority of the City Inspector, a vigorous effort was made to suppress the abominable nuisance of pigstys, which were then quite numerous in the upper Wards. The ordinance...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE MAYOR AND HIS FRIENDS. Our readers will remember that, in 1859, under the authority of the City Inspector, a vigorous effort was made to suppress the abominable nuisance of pigstys, which were then quite numerous in the upper Wards. The ordinance in that case requires that all keepers of swine should have the express warrant of the Mayor or City Inspector.

docs.snippet: Under date of July 8, the corespondent of the Missouri Democrat writes from Cairo:

docs.lead_paragraph: WILLIAMSBURGH DISPENSARY.?During the last month 645 persons were treated in this Dispensary, classified as follows: Males, 237; females, 408. Nativity?United States. 376; Ireland, 226; England, 25; Germany, 17; Scotland, 1. 639 prescriptions were gratuitously dispensed.

docs.snippet: Capt. G.L. WILLARD, of the Eighth Infantry, has been ordered to join his company at Newport, Ky., where a large regular force is about to be concentrated. Capt. W. is one of the officers raised from the ranks of the old Army some years ago, and his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. G.L. WILLARD, of the Eighth Infantry, has been ordered to join his company at Newport, Ky., where a large regular force is about to be concentrated. Capt. W. is one of the officers raised from the ranks of the old Army some years ago, and his company fortunately escaped the lot that befel the other companies of the Eighth in Texas.

docs.snippet: The supersedure, of Col. CRAIG as the head of the Ordnance Department, and the appointment of Lieutenant-Colonel RIPLEY to that post, is an unwarrantable infringement upon the regular course of military promotions, a cruel act of injustice to a...

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN WASHINGTON.; Col. Craig and the Ordnance Department Again The Cause of the Attempt to Supersede him The Law of Appointmentsin the Army, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The supersedure, of Col. CRAIG as the head of the Ordnance Department, and the appointment of Lieutenant-Colonel RIPLEY to that post, is an unwarrantable infringement upon the regular course of military promotions, a cruel act of injustice to a faithful public officer, and originate in motives utterly reckless of the public service. The truth

docs.snippet: The correspondent of the Louisville Courier writes from Winchester under date of June 26:
docs.lead_paragraph: The correspondent of the Louisville Courier writes from Winchester under date of June 26:

docs.snippet: Gen. BUTLER was so well pleased yesterday with the experiments with the Hotchkiss shells, that he at once ordered a large number for immediate use. They can be projected from the ordinary rifle cannon.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT FORTRESS MONROE.; ANOTHER CAPTURE BY THE QUAKER CITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. BUTLER was so well pleased yesterday with the experiments with the Hotchkiss shells, that he at once ordered a large number for immediate use. They can be projected from the ordinary rifle cannon.
